tuv.seg: When a person becomes unable to manage their assets because of mental incapacity, an application can be made to the courts for them to become a Ward of Court
Nuair a tharlaíonn sé nach féidir le duine a c(h)uid maoine a riaradh de bharr galair intinne, is féidir iarraidh ar na cúirteanna coimircí cúirte a dhéanamh de/di
The court must make a decision as to whether they are capable of managing their own property for his or her own benefit and the benefit of his or her dependants
Bíonn ar an gcúirt cinneadh a dhéanamh maidir le ábaltacht an duine sin a c(h)uid maoine a riaradh ar a s(h)on féin agus ar son a c(h)uid cleithiúnaithe
If it is decided that the person cannot manage their own property because of mental incapacity, a Committee is appointed to control the assets on the Ward's behalf
Má cheaptar nach féidir leis an duine a c(h)uid maoine a riaradh de bharr galair intinne, cuirtear Coiste i bhfeidhm chun na maoine a riaradh ar son an choimircí
A person under 18 years old may be taken into Wardship as a minor for reasons other than mental incapacity
Is féidir le duine faoi bhun ocht mbliana déag d'aois a bheith tógtha i gCoimircíocht mar mhionúr
When a person is under 18 years of age and is awarded damages, the money is paid into the court and invested on the minor's behalf until they reach the age of 18

Nuair a bhronntar damáistí ar dhuine faoi bhun ocht mbliana déag d'aois, íoctar an t-airgead don chúirt agus déantar infheistiú leis ar son an duine óig go dtí go mbeidh sé/sí ocht mbliana déag d'aois
People in this category are not Wards of Court
Ní Coimircithe Cúirte iad na daoine seo
If, however, the minor has special housing or care needs, they may be taken into Wardship as a minor
Ach, má bhíonn riachtanais speisialta tithíochta nó aire speisialta ag teastáil ón mionúr áfach, déantar Coimircí Cúirte de/di
If a house is bought for the minor, it is registered in their name
Má cheannaítear teach do mhionúr, bíonn sé cláraithe in ainm an mhionúir
When they reach the age of 18 years, provided they are of full mental capacity, they can apply to the High Court for payment of any funds held on their behalf

Nuair a bhíonn an mionúr ocht mbliana déag d'aois agus más rud é go bhfuil sé/sí i mbun a c(h)uid achmainní intinne ar fad, is féidir leis/léi iarraidh ar an ArdChúirt aon mhaoin atá ann ar a s(h)on a íoc leis/léi
To be made a Ward, the court must be satisfied that the person is of unsound mind and incapable of managing their own affairs
Sula ndéantar Coimircí Cúirte d'éinne, caithfidh an chúirt a bheith sásta go bhfuil an duine sin lagintinneach agus nach féidir leis/léi a c(h)uid cúrsaí féin a riaradh
In some cases, a person can be taken into Wardship for their own protection
I gcásanna áirithe, d'fhéadfadh duine a bheith tógtha i gcoimircíocht chun coimirce a thabhairt dó/dí
This would normally only arise in the case of a person with a mental disability rather than a psychiatric illness
Go hiondúil, tarlaíonn sé seo nuair a bhíonn míchumas intinne ar dhuine agus ní nuair a bhíonn galar síciatrach air/uirthi
How a person becomes a Ward of Court
An Chaoi a nDéantar Coimircí Cúirte de Dhuine
If you think there are grounds for someone being made a Ward of Court you should contact a solicitor to take the necessary steps
De ghnáth, is ball den chlann a dhéanann an t-iarratas, ach uaireanta is é dochtúir nó dlíodóir an choimircí molta a dhéanann an t-iarratas áfach
Alternatively, if you do not wish to be involved in the application yourself, you should write to the Registrar of Wards of Court asking for the necessary steps to be taken
Má cheapann tú go bhfuil cúiseanna ann le coimircí cúirte a dhéanamh de dhuine éigin, ba cheart teangbháil a dhéanamh le dlíodóir chun iarratas a dhéanamh
In either case, information must be provided about their medical condition, next-of-kin, assets and income
Muna bhfuil tú ag iarraidh aon bhaint a bheith agat leis an iarratas, is féidir teangbháil a dhéanamh le Cláraitheoir na gCoimircithe Cúirte chun tús a chur leis an bproiséas
If you are made a Ward of Court, the court may appoint a Committee to deal with your personal affairs
Dé ghnáth, (ach ní i gcónaí), is é an duine a dhéanann an t-iarratas an duine leis an gcumhacht mar Choiste ar son an Choimircí
The Committee means the person(s) into whose care the ward is committed
Ar aon chaoi, beidh an t-eolas seo a leanas i leith an Choimircí molta ag teastáil:
Notice of the application must be served to the proposed Ward
Caithfear an t-iarratas a chur in iúl don Choimircí Cúirte molta roimh ré
A proposed Ward is entitled to object to the application by writing to the Registrar of Wards of Court, usually, though not necessarily, through a solicitor
Tá sé de cheart ag Coimircí Cúirte molta dul in aghaidh an iarratais ach scríobh, trí mheán dlíodóra de ghnáth (ach níl dlíodóir riachtanach), chuig Cláraitheoir na gCoimircí Cúirte

A Ward who has dependants has a legal duty to maintain them and the Office of Wards of Court will make arrangements to provide for their maintenance and benefit according to their needs and the Ward's means

Tá dualgas de réir dlí ar Choimircí Cúirte a bhfuil cleithiúnaithe aige/aici sóláthrú dóibh. Eagróidh Oifig na gCoimircithe Cúirte liúntas cothaithe dóibh de réir na riachtanas a bheidh acu agus de réir achmhainní an Choimircí Chúirte
Relief and payment of income tax
Íocaíocht agus Faoiseamh ar Cháin Ioncaim

Wards have the same requirement to submit income tax returns as other taxpayers but the return is signed by the Committee on behalf of the Ward, or by the Ward's accountant, if they employed one before being brought into Wardship
Tá na dualgais chéanna ar Choimircithe Cúirte maidir le cáin ioncaim agus atá ar gach duine eile, ach bíonn an faisnéis ioncaim sínithe ag an gCoiste ar son an Choimircí Chúirte
The principal tax reliefs are where exemption is granted by the Chief Inspector of Taxes under Section 189 of the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 and medical expenses
An príomhfhaoiseamh cánach atá ar fáil ná faoiseamh a thugann an Príomhchigire Cánach faoi Roinn 189 den Acht um Cháin Chomhdhlúite 1997 agus costais leighis

After the President of the High Court has made an order bringing a person into Wardship they appoint a committee to act on behalf of the Ward and give directions to bring the Ward's assets under the control of the court and make them available for the maintenance and benefit of the Ward
Oibríonn an Coiste ar son an Choimircí Chúirte agus cuireann siad maoin an Choimircí Chúirte faoi smacht na cúirte chun iad a riaradh ar mhaithe leis an gCoimircí Cúirte

Where it is necessary to sell the Ward’s home to provide for nursing home expenses or to prevent it from being vandalised, the Committee will be authorised by the court to put the property on the market
Seo a leanas samplaí den chaoi a bhféadfaí maoin difriúla a láimhseáil:
Banks and building society accounts are usually closed and the proceeds lodged in court
• Cuntais bhainc: Go hiondúil, dúntar na cuntais seo agus cuirtear an t-airgead i dtaisce sa chúirt
Property cannot be bought on behalf of a Ward as an investment because this does not at present constitute an Authorised Trustee Security
Ní féidir teach a cheannach ar son Coimircí Chúirte mar infheistíocht, mar faoi láthair ní Iontaobhaí Urra Inghlactha é/í
A property may be bought on behalf of the Ward if they are able to reside in the community and have sufficient means and if the Ward does not have adequate or suitable accommodation

Is féidir teach a cheannach ar son Coimircí Chúirte más féidir leis an gCoimircí Cúirte cónaí san áit agus go bhfuil a d(h)óthain airgid aige/aici, nó nuair nach bhfuil teach oiriúnach aige/aici cheana féin
If the Ward is in residential care and their dependants need to be housed, property can be bought in the name of the Ward for their benefit
Más rud é go bhfuil an Coimircí Cúirte faoi chúram cónaithe agus go bhfuil teach ag teastáil óna gcleithiúnaithe, is féidir teach a cheannach ar son an Choimircí Chúirte
Medical care for Wards
Cúraimí Leighis don Choimircí Cúirte
In former years, most Wards were patients in hospital or nursing homes
Na blianta ó shin, ba othair in ospidéil nó i dtithe banaltrais a bhí sna Coimircithe Cúirte
Today, many live in the community or in sheltered accommodation
Sa lá atá inniu ann, tá alán acu ina gcónaí sa phobal nó i dtithe faoi dhídean
If a Ward needs medical treatment for which a consent form is required by the hospital, the approval of the President of the High Court should be obtained
Má bhíonn cóir leighis ag teastáil ó Choimircí Cúirte agus má theastaíonn ón ospidéal go mbeadh foirm sínithe ina leith, ba cheart cead a fháil ó Uachtarán na hArdChúirte
In emergency cases, it may not be possible to gain approval
Nuair is cás éigeandála é, b'fhéidir nach féidir é sin a dhéanamh
In this case, normal medical considerations should apply
Sa chás seo, leantar leis na modhanna leighis mar is ghnáth
A person who is a Ward because of mental incapacity cannot marry, although being taken into Wardship after marriage does not invalidate the marriage
Ní féidir le duine atá ina C(h)oimircí Cúirte de bharr éagmais intinne pósadh, ach ní chiallaíonn sé gur pósadh neamhbhailí é pósadh a tharla sular deineadh Coimircí Cúirte den duine pósta
A Ward of Court may not leave Ireland without the consent of the President of the High Court
Níl cead ag Coimircí Cúirte Éire a fhágáil gan chead ó Uachtarán na hArdChúirte
In practice, permission to leave the jurisdiction is normally granted, taking into account medical or safety considerations
Go hiondúil, tugtar cead an Stát a fhágaint ag tógaint cúrsaí leighis agus slándála san áireamh
An application by a Ward to be discharged from Wardship must be made to the Registrar of Wards of Court in writing by the Ward or by a solicitor on their behalf
Caithfidh Coimircí Cúirte, nó a d(h)líodóir iarratas scríofa a dhéanamh chuig Cláraitheoir na gCoimircithe Cúirte más rud é go dteastaíonn uaidh/uaithi a bheith scaoilte ó choimircíocht
The application should be based on medical evidence to the effect that the Ward is now sound of mind and capable of managing their own affairs
Caithfidh an t-iarratas a bheith bunaithe ar fhianaise leighis ag rá go bhfuil sláinte intinne ag an gCoimircí Cúirte agus gur féidir leis/léi a c(h)uid maoine a riaradh
A Ward may make a will if:
Is féidir le Coimircí Cúirte uacht a dhéanamh má:
• They express the wish to make a will
• Tá fonn air/uirthi uacht a dhéanamh
• There is medical evidence that they are capable of making a valid will
• Tá fianaise leighis ann go bhfuil an duine sin ábalta uacht a dhéanamh
• The solicitor instructed by the Ward is satisfied that they are capable of making a valid will
• Tá dlíodóir an Choimircí Chúirte sásta go bhfuil an Coimircí Cúirte ábalta uacht éifeachtach a dhéanamh
When a Ward dies
Nuair a fhaigheann Coimircí Cúirte bás

When a Ward dies, after any debts have been paid and when a Grant of Probate or Administration has issued, the estate is distributed according to the Ward's will or under the rules of intestate succession

Nuair a fhaigheann Coimircí Cúirte bás, roinntear an t-eastát de réir uachta an Choimircí Chúirte, nó de réir rialacha sleachta díthiomnacha, tar éis aon fhiacha a íoc agus Deonú Probháide nó Riaracháin a eisiúint
Legal fees from a Wardship application are normally paid out of the Ward's estate
Íoctar táillí iarratais Choimircíochta as eastát an Choimircí Chúirte
These costs include solicitor's fees, medical report fees and stamp duty
Tugann na costais seo táillí na ndlíodóirí, táillí na dtuairiscí leighis agus stampdhleacht san áireamh
Court percentages (annual levy on Ward's income) are also payable
Caithfear céatadáin chúirte (gearradh bliantúil ar Ioncam an Choimircí Chúirte) a íoc freisin
At present, the maximum rate of court percentages is €750 per annum
Faoi láthair, is é 750 Euro in aghaidh na bliana an t-uasráta atá ag na céatadáin chúirte
This maximum rate only applies if the Ward's net income in the proceeding tax year was €18,750 or more
Ní bhíonn an t-uasráta seo i bhfeidhm ach nuair nach raibh ioncam 18,750 Euro nó níos mó ag an gCoimircí Cúirte sa bhliain roimhe
Contact your solicitor or the Office of Wards of Court
Teangbháil a dhéanamh le do dhlíodóir nó le hOifig na gCoimircithe Cúirte
More information is available in the Courts Service's booklet on the Office of Wards of Court (pdf)
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar fáil i leabhrán na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna ar Oifig na gCoimircithe Cúirte (pdf)
